solution_line_template: There are {cents_per_dollar} cents in each $1 so ${dollars_capital} gives {dollars_capital}*{cents_per_dollar} cents = <<{dollars_capital}*{cents_per_dollar}={total_cents_capital}>>{total_cents_capital} cents

To recover her capital of {total_cents_capital} cents from a selling price of {selling_price_per_egg_cents} cents per egg she has to sell {total_cents_capital}/{selling_price_per_egg_cents} = <<{total_cents_capital}/{selling_price_per_egg_cents}={eggs_to_sell_to_recover_capital}>>{eggs_to_sell_to_recover_capital} eggs

There were {initial_eggs} eggs in the crate to start with so she will have {initial_eggs}-{eggs_to_sell_to_recover_capital} = <<{initial_eggs}-{eggs_to_sell_to_recover_capital}={eggs_left}>>{eggs_left} eggs left
